ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Respondent
Respondent details
The event name for which the data was collected
Does the subject report decline in memory?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 8= Could not be assessed/Subject it too impaired

ElementDescription: Does the co-participant report a decline in the subjects memory?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 8= Could not be assessed/Subject it too impaired

ElementDescription: Based on the clinicians judgement, is the subject currently experiencing meaningful impairment in cognition?
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Memory
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Orientation
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Executive Function
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Language
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Visuospatial Function
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Attention, Concentration
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Fluctuating Cognition
If yes, at what age did the fluctuating cognition begin?
Indicate whether the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, relative to previously attained abilities, in the following cognitive domains, or has fluctuating cognition: Other
If other, noting the subject currently is meaningfully impaired, please specify:
Indicate the predominant symptom that was first recognized as a decline in the subjects cognition:
Notes: 1= Memory; 2= Orientation; 3= Executive Function; 4= Language; 5= Visuospatial Function; 6= Attention/Concentration; 7= Fluctuating Cognition; 8= Other; 99= Unknown

ElementDescription: If other, predominant cognitive symptom, please specify:
Mode of onset of cognitive symptoms:
If other, onset of cognitive symptoms, please specify:
Based on the clinicians judgement, at what age did the cognitive decline begin?
Based on the clinicians judgement, is the subject currently experiencing any kind of behavioral symptoms?
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Apathy, Withdrawal
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Depressed Mood
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Psychosis, Visual Hallucinations
If yes, are the hallucinations well formed and detailed?
If well formed, clear-cut visual hallucinations, at what age did these visual hallucinations begin?
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Psychosis, Auditory Hallucinations
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Psychosis, Abnormal, false or delusional beliefs
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Disinhibition
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Irritability
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Agitation
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Personality Change
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: REM Sleep Behavior Disorder
If yes, at what age did the REM Sleep Behavior Disorder begin?
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Anxiety
Indicate whether the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior in any of the following ways: Other
If other, noting the subject currently manifests meaningful change in behavior, please specify:
Indicate the predominant symptom that was first recognized as a decline in the subjects behavior:
Notes: 1= Apathy/Withdrawal; 2= Depressed Mood; 3= Psychosis; 4= Disinhibition; 5= Irritability; 6= Agitation; 7= Personality Change; 8= REM Sleep Behavior Disorder; 9= Anxiety; 10= Other; 99= Unknown

ElementDescription: If other, predominant behavior symptom, please specify:
Mode of onset of behavioral symptoms:
If other, onset of behavioral symptoms, please specify:
Based on the clinicians judgement, at what age did the behavioral symptoms begin?
Based on the clinicians judgement, is the subject currently experiencing any motor symptoms?
Indicate whether the subject currently has meaningful change in motor function in any of the following areas: Gait Disorder
Indicate whether the subject currently has meaningful change in motor function in any of the following areas: Falls
Indicate whether the subject currently has meaningful change in motor function in any of the following areas: Tremor
Indicate whether the subject currently has meaningful change in motor function in any of the following areas: Slowness
Indicate the predominant symptom that was first recognized as a decline in the subjects motor function:
Notes: 1= Gait Disorder; 2= Falls; 3= Tremor; 4= Slowness; 99= Unknown

ElementDescription: Mode of onset of motor symptoms:
If other, onset of motor symptoms, please specify:
Were there changes in motor function suggestive of parkinsonism?
If yes, at what age did the motor symptoms suggestive of parkinsonism begin?
Were changes in motor function suggestive of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)?
If yes, at what age did the motor symptoms suggestive of ALS begin?
Based on the clinicians judgement, at what age did the motor changes begin?
Overall course of decline of cognitive/behavioral/motor syndrome:
Notes: 1= Gradually Progressive; 2= Stepwise; 3= Static; 4= Fluctuating; 5= Improved; 8= NA; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Indicate the predominant domain that was first recognized as changed in the subject:
Notes: 1= Cognition; 2= Behavior; 3= Motor Function; 8= NA; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: Is the subject a potential candidate for further evaluation for Lewy Body Disease?
Is the subject a potential candidate for further evaluation for frontotemporal lobar degeneration?
